Comment: It's probably impossible to walk the tight rope of being palatable to people who hate Trump while staying on Trump's good side in federal politics. Why Rubio would trade a relatively secure senate job for Secretary of State to a moron who likes to play the you are fired game is one of the bigger head scratchers I've ever seen. I can't tell if Rubio genuinely saw this as some duty to check Trump's worst impulses or if he was dumb and saw this as an opportunity for the spotlight. Regardless it made no sense. Rubio's whole brand was being the respectable establishment Republican. Knifing Ukraine in the back was never going to endear him to his base of his support and he's never going to have genuine populist bona fides.  It's somewhat unfortunate as prior to this I kind of respected Marco. Yeah he's a political survivor who read the room correctly in 2021 and carried water for Trump but he's one of like 3 Republican senators who writes serious legislation. For all the support we have for Liz Cheney now every bill she wrote was like we should give X oil company 4 billion dollars as a thank you for my sponsors.
